channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @datadivajf Was he in his own time?
@pesachology @EladNehorai But it also promises compelling-at-first-glance solutions to real but insoluble problems.
@AkivaMCohen @pnjaban Very smart Google advertising campaigns by the firm?
@datadivajf @dabeard Do you think Herschel became a Jewish name because of his music or because of his astronomy?
Republican values. https://t.co/OcujlvLfAI
@rmneiss I’ll do kal v’chomer. What’s your favorite?
Love to see the WH praising bipartisanship while Republicans run roughshod over liberty in Florida and Texas. https://t.co/Vl6PidDPbV
In which next gen animators present a grim view of matzah romance. https://t.co/JWnLU2YXLc
@ZacharyBraiterm @mkoplow Arthur Waskow wrote an inclusivist midrash on the topic many years ago. https://t.co/IcRGaJSsEx

@HannahLebovits @MicahGreenland @Jewish_Action No doubt I read this when it came out, but fascinating. I’m particularly interested in your argument on how Hamodia might be impacting Out Of Town communities. One question is whether it’s really different than the Jewish Press, which I remember seeing in frum Rochester homes.
@typolad @HannahLebovits @MicahGreenland @Jewish_Action @JewishStandard That’s for my boss to decide. But if he’s interested, I’ll pitch it. Let me know.
@typolad @HannahLebovits @MicahGreenland @Jewish_Action Come to North Jersey. We’ll give you a monthly column!

@typolad @Baalbatish1 @HannahLebovits @MicahGreenland @Jewish_Action Someone needs to convince Agudah machers that supporting third-party friendly voting formats is Daas Torah as it would enable Agudah to sit in the NYS Legislature as they did in the Polish Duma back in the day.
@typolad @HannahLebovits @MicahGreenland @Jewish_Action Hmmm. Wondering whether even absent a local SIR gig he might be local enough for a @JewishStandard profile.

@HannahLebovits @MicahGreenland @Jewish_Action Exactly. And that’s very different than saying it’s a mitzvah to vote once or twice a year. Being a Republican has become a והגהתם וים ולילה kind of thing.
@HannahLebovits @MicahGreenland @Jewish_Action Interesting.
@MicahGreenland @HannahLebovits @Jewish_Action The Rebbe wasn’t messaging based on what a political operator had decided was a useful talking point.

@Shmarya Can I interest you in ghostwriting “The Covid Health Secrets of The Rashbi: How the Practices of Judaism’s Ancient Mystical Master Will Protect You From Any Pandemic”?
@Shmarya In other words, spin out “Stay in your man cave, Dude” into 20,000 spiritually refreshing and validating words?
If I’m reading this correctly, this is about the local GOP establishment waxing antisemitic in their battle against Trumpist insurgents. https://t.co/UgcAtSm0hz

@devbak01 @onthemainline @RabbiPoupko @hmabramson @DBashIdeas @FriedmanRabbi @mlitwack @kampeas @ZvikaKlein @YWNReporter @YosefRapaport @MeyerLabin @pinidunner That is not nearly as racist as the statement quoted in my blog, attributed to a deceased Rebbe by an anonymous commenter so I'm not repeating it here.
@EladNehorai @IlhanMN It's all about the cruelty. What's a dogwhistle if the whistler will embrace and encourage your Arab-punching?

Hadassah signs on a an anti-BDS legal brief with the implicit argument that a company refusing to stock West Bank wine in their cafeteria (as Israelis such as Amos Oz have urged) is not making statement protected by the First Amendment. https://t.co/b41tKobGte
If the federal Appellate Court takes up the appeal, and if it wins, it would be fun to see a pro-BDS group argue for a First Amendment Free Exercise exemption from anti-boycott laws.
Though I imagine that would lead to Amicus briefs arguing that Islam is not a Constitutionally-protected religion, which is certainly a plausible ruling by the current #RogueRobertsCourt, which has effectively shown that it is not bound by constitutional precedent.

@HannahLebovits What’s new is the privatization of politics, rather than outsourcing leadership to Agudah et al. Obviously a reflection of similar trends across America, and a result of both polarization and social media.
